dot.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a small round mark or spot
dot.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: something that looks like a small spot because it is so far away
dot.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: The plane was just a dot on the horizon.
dot.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a short sound or flash of light used when sending messages by Morse code
dot.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to mark something by putting a dot on it or above it
dot.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: if an area is dotted with things, there are a lot of them there but they are spread far apart
dot.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: The lake was dotted with sailboats.
The company has over 20 stores dotted around the country.
dot.translation[1].definitions[1].note_b: Dot is often passive in this meaning
dot.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to put a very small amount of something on a surface, especially in several places
dot.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: a small round mark, for example the one used over the letter i. If you are telling someone your EMAIL address, you refer to the round mark between the words as dot
dot.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: If you need to email me, you can contact me at john dot jones at pearson dot com.
dot.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: if something happens at a certain time on the dot, it happens at exactly that time
dot.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: The meeting begins at 9.30 on the dot.
dot.translation[2].definitions[2].defini: to find or show that there is a relationship between several ideas, facts etc
dot.translation[2].definitions[2].exampl: It took years of work by a team of investigators to connect all the dots and show that he was guilty.
